heading: feds urge net gambling ban
subheading: a federal commission says the net gambling ban should continue. the two-year study suggests that congress pass laws to deal with financial institutions that work with illegal casinos.
author: wired news report
text: a federal commission wants the ban on internet gambling to continue. the draft of a two-year study, released this week by the national gambling impact study commission, urges congress to keep online gambling illegal. the report asks "the [department of justice to] develop enforcement strategies including, but not limited to, internet service providers, credit-card providers, and money transfer agencies."the panel is asking congress to prohibit wire transfers to known internet gambling sites or the banks that represent them. furthermore, they want legislation that would prevent gamblers from recovering money lost through credit-card wagering.the commission also recommends that the us government persuade foreign governments not to support offshore casinos that target american citizens.the final report -- which will go to president clinton, congress, state governors, and indian tribal leaders -- is due on 18 june.the commission was established to determine the social and economic impacts of gambling on federal, state, and local agencies, as well as indian tribal governments and communities.
